page.title: 10HENLLE HALL, GOBOWEN
page.content: {Henlle Hall}is situated to the north of Gobowen village. Built in 1794, for most of its life it was owned by the Lovatt family whose last descendants moved out in 1972. Today it belongs to {His Honour Judge Woolley and his wife. One of the Lovatts served in China as an army colonel. Another, Henrietta, was in the dining room when the roof collapsed and she was crushed to death. The estate once covered over 200 acres but now is only 17, four are garden, the rest is woodland or rough grazing for a small flock of Jacobs sheep. Inside the hall, six ground floor{rooms}include;kitchen,drawing, games, dining,feather(borders painted in game bird feathers) and parlour. There are 13 bedrooms.A large staff was once employed at the hall but now there are only two part time helpers.
